skill.name: latchbio-integration
skill.description: Latch platform for bioinformatics workflows. Build pipelines with Latch SDK, @workflow/@task decorators, deploy serverless workflows, LatchFile/LatchDir, Nextflow/Snakemake integration.
skill.summary: Latch platform for bioinformatics workflows. Build pipelines with Latch SDK, @workflow/@task decorat...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing markdown guides and JSON configuration. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or credential collection. Purely informational content about LatchBio platform.

content.user_title: Build LatchBio workflows and data pipelines
content.value_statement: Deploying bioinformatics pipelines is complex and time consuming. This skill guides you through Latch workflow design, data registry, and resource configuration.
actual_capabilities: Draft Latch SDK workflows using @workflow and task decorators
Explain LatchFile and LatchDir cloud storage usage and paths
Outline Registry setup with projects, tables, and records
Recommend resource decorators for CPU, memory, and GPU tasks
Summarize verified workflow options for common analyses
Describe Nextflow and Snakemake integration steps
limitations: Requires a Latch account and the Latch SDK for real execution
Examples assume Python and Docker are available locally
Does not run or validate workflows in your environment
Platform quotas and limits must be checked on Latch

use_cases.title: Launch RNA seq workflow
use_cases.description: Design a Latch workflow structure for RNA seq with clear inputs and outputs.

use_cases.title: Standardize task resources
use_cases.description: Define resource decorators for CPU, memory, and GPU workloads in a pipeline.

use_cases.title: Organize registry data
use_cases.description: Set up Registry tables and records for tracking samples and results.

prompt_templates.title: Start a workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a simple Latch workflow outline with two tasks and LatchFile inputs. Include brief docstrings for UI.

prompt_templates.title: Add registry tracking
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to create a Registry project, table, and record for samples linked to a workflow.

prompt_templates.title: Tune resources
prompt_templates.prompt: Recommend task decorators and resource settings for a pipeline with QC, alignment, and GPU inference.

prompt_templates.title: Integrate Nextflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how to register a Nextflow pipeline on Latch and what inputs should be mapped.

output_examples.input: Design a Latch workflow for RNA seq with one GPU step and registry tracking.
output: Define QC and alignment as small or large CPU tasks
Use a large GPU task for the GPU step
Track samples in a Registry table with fastq_file and status columns
Return results to a LatchDir path for organized outputs

best_practices: Use type annotations and docstrings to improve the UI
Start with standard task decorators and scale up only when needed
Design workflows as small modular tasks for reuse
anti_patterns: Using large GPU tasks for simple file parsing
Skipping Registry schema design before bulk data entry
Ignoring Docker validation before workflow registration

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it is written for general LLM use and works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What limits should I expect on Latch resources?
faq.answer: Limits depend on your workspace quotas and platform caps for CPU, memory, GPU, and runtime.

faq.question: Can I integrate existing Nextflow or Snakemake pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill explains how to register Nextflow or Snakemake pipelines on Latch.

faq.question: Does the skill access my data or credentials?
faq.answer: No, it contains only documentation and examples, with no data access or collection.

faq.question: What should I do if registration fails?
faq.answer: Check Docker status, run latch login, and retry with verbose logs to see errors.

faq.question: How does Latch compare to other workflow tools?
faq.answer: Latch focuses on serverless bioinformatics workflows with a built in UI and data registry.
